intro: Eutrema zhuxiense, commonly known as the Zhuxi sea蒲, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in saline or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species for ecological studies in arid and coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
